text:
Hi everyone! I am Niharika thanks for clicking.
Well in today’s lesson we are going to talk

about Celebrities. Now we all discuss about
celebrities. Who are celebrities? Well they

are the rich, famous very well known people.
So any common man recognizes them, so they

are Celebrities. So we tend to discuss a lot,
well rather we gossip too much about celebrities.

We admire them, we read their articles, we
follow them on the social media, we do lot

of things. So in English talking about celebrities
can be very helpful, in fact you would tend

to learn lot of informal words too. So that’s
what we are going to learn in today’s lesson.

We are going to look at some phrases, some
words, some vocabulary related to celebrities.

So let’s get started. Very first one ‘Claim
to fame’, now what does this phrase really
mean? Claim to fame is when someone has a reason to become famous.
So… so  reason to be famous like, Michael Jackson

claim to fame was his dancing style. Well
we all know Michael Jackson, he was a great

dancer. His claim to fame was his unique dancing
style. So that’s how you can use this phrase.

Another one is ‘Versatile’, he is a versatile
actor. So versatile is someone who is an all-rounder,

someone who fits into any kind of role. So
that actor is absolutely versatile. Another

one ‘Glamorous’. Now glamourous yes, we
can use it for actors, we can use it for so

many people even for writers and journalists
the famous journalist. They are so glamourous,

they are so full of glamour. So ‘Glamorous’
is a perfect adjective, who is very fascinatingly

attractive. So most of the celebrities are
very glamourous. So go ahead and use this

word for them. The next one ‘A one trip
pony’. ‘A one trip pony’ is exact opposite

of a versatile actor. Well it is used for
a person who is just good at one thing, just

one special feature and that’s about it.
So there are so many actors who are versatile

but there are couple of actors who can do
just one thing. So ‘A one trip pony’ is

someone who has one special feature, who is
just good at one thing. Then the next one

‘Overrated’, well there are so many actors
who are absolutely overrated. Well not just

actors I believe even sports people, sport
persons. So they are also very overrated.

So overrated means, its used for a person
who is highly acclaimed but really doesn’t

deserve that. So people talk about them, they
are highly paid but they really don’t deserve

that. So someone who is not really well deserving,
but yes is considered to be at a very-very

high peak. So all that fame is totally not
deserving. Next one ‘Arrogant’. Well,

have you ever got a chance to meet a celebrity
or even to just see a celebrity? Well you

know there are times I do, in fact when I
travel I do come across a lot of celebrities

especially at the airport or maybe in my flight
and some are really nice, some are really

down to earth. Now down to earth means they
are very polite, they are very genuine. So

that’s down to earth. But the opposite of
down to earth is ‘Arrogant’ who is full

of oneself. So 
someone who is full of oneself, who has this
big attitude he is an arrogant person. The

next one ‘Highest Accolade’. Now ‘Highest
Accolade’ is someone who has achieved the

greatest prize, someone who has done such
a great job that has been awarded. So there

are sports persons, there are actors who have
done incredible job and they are highest accolade.

So ‘Highest Accolade’ it means they are
awarded with the best of praise. The next

one ‘Glowing Tributes’, his career has
absolutely glowing tributes. Its means everybody

just talks positive about this person, about
this celebrity. So someone who has everything

positive about him or her. So there’s is
nothing negative to talk about this celebrity,

always been in good books be it for the media,
be it for common people. So they, such people

have ‘Glowing Tributes’. Then the next
one ’Big Break’. Well I believe, Adam

Sander has got this big break. So big break
is a big opportunity. So the people you know

there are small some actors who work hard
and eventually they get this big opportunity

to probably work with the best of directors
or with the best of people, so they get a

big break. And then the last one that I have
here is ‘Victim of their own success’.

So the celebrities who are very successful,
but there are all negative comments or negative

things to talk about them and why is that?
Well you know they are successful but the

success has got into their head. You know
they, because they are so successful and so

famous and rich they tend to get very arrogant
and very mean. So if a celebrity is arrogant

and is mean then people are not gonna appreciate
that and people are not gonna like that. So

therefore they will talk negative about them.
So that exactly the reason why we use this

phrase. So these actors who are mean, who
are arrogant, success has got into their head

well they are victim of their own success.
So though they are successful what’s the

point people have all negative stuff to talk
about them. In fact it is the opposite of

glowing tributes. So ‘Glowing Tributes’
is used for all positive comments over for

a celebrity, whereas ‘Victim of their own
success’ well it’s all negative. So go

ahead use these phrases it’s a great way
to talk about celebrities. Talk with

your friends, with your family and I’ll
be back with a new lesson till then take care.
